title: Turning Point's Super Bowl Halftime show slammed as 'embarrassing'
desc: The late Charlie Kirk's political organization Turning Point USA will be holding an alternate Super Bowl halftime show in protest of Bad Bunny's performance.

title: Netanyahu warns of democratic erosion
desc: Netanyahu said Israel’s democratic balance has eroded at a Knesset ceremony marked by opposition boycotts and the absence of senior judicial figures.

title: Dusty May, Tom Izzo accuse each other's team of dirty play
desc: Michigan coach Dusty May and Michigan State coach Tom Izzo are accusing each other's team of dirty play during Friday's game. Said May: "It wasn't an illusion."

title: 35 State Coalition Demand App & Play Store Delete X to Stop Grok Porn Wave
desc: Coalition demands federal ban of Grok AI after chatbot generated 6,700+ sexual images per hour, targeting Pentagon's $200 million defense contract.

title: Injury forces Canada's Deanna Stellato-Dudek, figure skating partner Deschamps out of Olympic team event
desc: World figure skating champions Deanna Stellato-Dudek and Maxime Deschamps of Canada will not compete in the Olympic team event in Italy later this month due to a training injury in Quebec sustained by Stellato-Dudek, the Canadian Olympic Committee announced Monday.

title: Palestinian Films Are Landing Oscar Nominations. But Hollywood Continues to Block Them.
desc: ‘The Voice of Hind Rajab’ and ‘Palestine 36’ show the wide range of Palestinian stories amid U.S. distribution struggles.

title: Miniaturized ultrasound system may enable earlier detection of breast cancer
desc: For people who are at high risk of developing breast cancer, frequent screenings with ultrasound can help detect tumors early. MIT researchers have now developed a miniaturized ultrasound system that could make it easier for breast ultrasounds to be performed more often, either at home or at a doctor's office.
